newsitem.title: JAPAN: Daiwa Sec says non-bank unit must write off loans.
newsitem.headline: Daiwa Sec says non-bank unit must write off loans.

text.p: Daiwa Securities Co Ltd said on Tuesday that its non-bank affiliate needs to write off more than 100 billion yen worth of problem loans.
Daiwa Securities wants to provide support to the non-bank affiliate as soon as possible in the current business year.
Daiwa, Japan's second biggest brokerage, will use profits from sales of stock to give this financial support, as well as its internal reserves and current profits, a Daiwa executive told reporters.
"We are now working this (plan for financial support) out ... We are discussing this with the National Tax Agency and with accountants," he said.
He also said the company plans to give the financial support on a lump-sum basis.
